revision.comment: /* top */Remove category; page contains an infobox. Did [[WP:AWB/GF|general fixes]] if needed.
revision.text: {{Talk header}} {{WikiProjectBannerShell|1= {{WikiProject Biography|living=n|class=Start|listas=Shays, Daniel|military-work-group=y}} {{WikiProject Military history|class=Start |B1 =y |B2 =n |B3 =y |B4 =y |B5 =y |Biography=y|US=y|ARW=y}} {{WikiProject United States|class=Start|importance=Mid|attention=y|listas=Shays, Daniel|USMIL=y|ARW=y|MA=y}} {{WikiProject United States History|class=Start|importance=Mid}} }} ==Untitled== Corrected entry to read Massachusetts, not New Jersey. Replaced "No actual fighting took place during the incident, but tensions quickly escalated." With "Four men were killed - the first casualties of the rebellion - and many were wounded." From http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shays_Rebellion [[User:AmyStevens|AmyStevens] ::I think we need a better source than bratanica for that. Hopefully someone can find one. That our own articles are the source of all the top hits for "Killed" and "shays" in Google is not a very promising sign. - [[User:Nunh-huh|Nunh-huh]] 19:26, 24 April 2006 (UTC) ::::David P. Szatmary, Shays' Rebellion: The Making of an Agrarian Insurrection. "In desperation the militamen then aimed two cannons directly at the rebels and fired fourteen or fifteen rounds of grapeshot into their ranks. When the smoke cleared, the blood of four dead and twenty wounded farmers stained the snow-covered ground around the arsenal as the bulk of the farmers retreated from Springfield to nearby towns." p. 102 It would be nice if his reasons for fighting were covered better. The comment at the end about the principles of the revolutionary war and the rebellion being the same is confusing because we aren't told what those principles are! Yes, and it would be nicer if you actually told like a summary about the story. Exmaples like" Who, What, When, Where, How, and why. This would be more useful for students!!! everybody knows Daniel is a girls name its not funny.fart\ I like this Page...and it was very helpful! What group is he in? Fighting Clup —Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/67.81.76.14|67.81.76.14]] ([[User talk:67.81.76.14|talk]]) 21:19, 18 December 2008 (UTC) The article begins with 'Daniel Shays, January 25, 1787." This is presumably the date on the assault on the Springfield arsenal but as it is, there is no indication whatsoever what the significance of this date is. Also, there is no mention of Shays' date of birth in the article. I have found articles which say it is 1747. —Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/68.61.153.152|68.61.153.152]] ([[User talk:68.61.153.152|talk]]) 17:08, 2 November 2007 (UTC) I detest these no-talent assclowns who have nothing better to do than vandalize wikipedia. will someone please fix this? —Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/130.184.85.27|130.184.85.27]] ([[User talk:130.184.85.27|talk]]) 08:51, 2 December 2007 (UTC) A section of US 202 in Massachusetts is labeled as the Daniel Shays Highway ([http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/U.S._Route_202#Massachusetts]). Is this worth adding to the text of the article? [[User:Owsteele|ows]] ([[User talk:Owsteele|talk]]) —Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|undated]] comment was added at 03:30, 14 December 2008 (UTC). Here is some evidence that he was actually born in Holliston, MA - not Hopkinton (http://books.google.com/books?id=OmgUAAAAYAAJ&pg=RA1-PR15&dq=holliston+indians+massachusett+nipmuc&ei=6aL0SeHDH5LgywTP-JCxDA). Don't know much else, unfortunately. [[User:Martin.fish|Martin.fish]] ([[User talk:Martin.fish|talk]]) 18:14, 26 April 2009 (UTC) == Constitution? == Article states he is "well-remembered for his role in the creation of the Constitution." as of Oct 11 2010. I think it is more accurate to say "participation in the American Revolution." [[User:Mfbabcock|EtherDoc]] ([[User talk:Mfbabcock|talk]]) 12:39, 11 October 2010 (UTC) :: That role would presumably be that the Constitution was intended to stop such rebellions. But this will have to be deleted if it stays unsourced I think. --[[User:Mujokan|Mujokan]] ([[User talk:Mujokan|talk]]) 00:11, 2 November 2010 (UTC) == Images not linked at article head == There's a formatting mistake concerning images which I lack the expertise to fix: Miscoded image links. (Viewing in Beta). [[User:Infoaddicted|Infoaddicted]] ([[User talk:Infoaddicted|talk]]) 05:25, 25 January 2010 (UTC)
